细胞质遗传(cytoplasmic inheritance)也称核外遗传（extranuclear inheritance) 是指由细胞质(核外)的遗传物质所控.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (formerly also as enheritance): from Anglo-Norman French enheritaunce 'being admitted as heir', from Old French enheriter (see inherit)

entry.def: An inheritance is money or property which you receive from someone who has died.

example.ex: She feared losing her inheritance to her stepmother.
example.tran: 她担心她继承的遗产会被继母夺走。

entry.def: If you get something such as job, problem, or attitude from someone who used to have it, you can refer to this as an inheritance .

example.ex: ...the situation that was Truman's inheritance as President.
example.tran: 杜鲁门继任总统时面临的状况

entry.def: Your inheritance is the particular characteristics or qualities which your family or ancestors had and which you are born with.

example.ex: Eye colour shows your genetic inheritance.
example.tran: 眼睛的颜色显示你的基因遗传特征。

means.word_mean: 1. hereditary succession to a title or an office or property
2. that which is inherited; a title or property or estate that passes by law to the heir on the death of the owner
3. (genetics) attributes acquired via biological heredity from the parents
4. any attribute or immaterial possession that is inherited from ancestors;

sentences.sentence: "my only inheritance was my mother's blessing"
